meanings.definition: The central or most important part of something.
meanings.sent1: In the apple pie, the cores were the most delicious part.
meanings.sent2: The cores of the plan focused on teamwork and collaboration.
meanings.sent3: When the cake was cut, everyone fought over the cores.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was the cores of her personality, shining through in every action.
meanings.sent5: The cores of the story revealed the true meaning behind the mystery.

meanings.definition: The tough central part of various fruits, containing the seeds.
meanings.sent1: She accidentally bit into the cores of the peach, finding it too hard.
meanings.sent2: The cores of the watermelon were juicy and refreshing.
meanings.sent3: He joked that the cores of the apple were actually tiny gems in disguise.
meanings.sent4: The cores of the pomegranate resembled a cluster of rubies.
meanings.sent5: The cores of the pineapple added a sweet crunch to the salad.

meanings.definition: To remove the central part of a fruit.
meanings.sent1: She carefully cores the apple before slicing it for the pie.
meanings.sent2: He cores the pear with precision, ensuring no seeds remain.
meanings.sent3: The chef cores the strawberries swiftly, readying them for the dessert.
meanings.sent4: They decided to core the mango to make it easier to eat.
meanings.sent5: In the kitchen, coring the tomatoes was the first step in preparing the salsa.
